document_data.name: Temple of Sune
document_data.organizations: Organizations in the Temple of Sune (Bezantur)
document_data.mainbody: The '''Temple of Sune''' in [[Bezantur]], [[Thay]], was a place of worship dedicated to [[Sune]] that was popular with the locals as a place to meet romantic prospects.
document_data.Location: The temple was located in south-central Bezantur, the so-called "City of a Thousand Temples". It was quite close to the [[Temple of Lliira (Bezantur)|Temple of Lliira]],
document_data.Structure: The temple itself was an elegant palace well suited to events that provided opportunities for entertainment and indulgence.
document_data.Activities:
Owing to the lavish festivals and feasts hosted at the temple, it was a popular place to socialize and meet potential romantic partners, even or especially among those who did not actively worship Sune.

The [[Church of Sune|congregation]] attracted individuals who were generally not well aligned with the beliefs and attitudes of the ruling [[Red Wizards of Thay]], however they were largely left alone, owing to the fact that they also generally lacked any political power or ambition.
document_data.History: Following the opening of the [[Temple of Sharess (Bezantur)|Temple of Sharess]] in Bezantur, Sune's following began to dwindle as worshipers flocked to the more openly hedonistic delights of [[Sharess]]. By the late 1360s [[DR]], Sune's catty worshipers were actively spreading rumors to portray worshipers of Sharess as crude, uncivilized, and debauched.
